EXISTING STRUCTURES
────────────────────
### Extraction System at Position(-3.5, 27.5)
Consists of:
– A burner inserter with drop position at (–3.5, 28.5)
Use-case: Acts as the resource extraction node whose output is routed via transport belts.

### Copper Cable Factory at Position(2.5, 17.5)
Consists of:
– Cable factory input chest at (2.5, 17.5)
– Dedicated factory burner inserter at (3.5, 17.5) (placed using direction RIGHT)
– Connected neighbor entities including a burner inserter at (2.5, 16.5) and an assembling machine at (1.5, 19.5)
Use-case: Interfaces the copper cable production process by feeding raw resources into the assembly chain.

### Belt Depot Structure at Position(3.5, 15.5)
Consists of:
– A wooden chest placed at (3.5, 15.5) serving as the belt depot
– A dedicated transport belt segment positioned at (4.5, 15.5) adjacent to the chest
– A depot burner inserter placed at (3.5, 14.5) (using direction UP) with its pickup aligned to the chest and drop set at (3.5, 13.5)
Use-case: Provides an isolated belt target that is meant to receive items from the extraction system via a multi‐segment transport belt.

### Power Generation Facility at Position(–0.5, 24.5)
Consists of:
– A steam engine (generator) located at (–0.5, 24.5)
– A boiler at (–5.5, 24.0)
– An offshore pump at (–7.5, 25.5)
Use-case: Forms the electrical power system where the boiler and pump supply the conditions for steam production feeding the generator.

────────────────────
Note: Additional entities (such as a laboratory, extra furnaces, and standalone chests) are present on the map but have not been grouped into an integrated structure by the current deployment steps.

ERROR TIPS
────────────────────
• Transport Belt Connection Errors  
  – When connecting transport belts, the target must not be a direct Prototype.SteamEngine object. Always use an inserter (or similar intermediary) that accepts items to serve as the belt’s delivery target.

• Placement Distance Error  
  – If an entity cannot be placed because the target position is too far from the player (e.g. wooden-chest at (3.5, 15.5) with the player at (0, 0)), move closer to the target position to remain within the maximum placement range.

• Inventory Availability Error  
  – Before attempting to place an item (such as a wooden chest), confirm that the item is present in the inventory to avoid placement failures.

• Variable Reference Error  
  – Ensure all variables referenced (for example, using ‘target_chest’) are properly defined to prevent NameError issues during execution.
